    • References


  • 1. Assessment Examination - itch.io game
  • 2. Unwillingly training Google's AI Models - Article
  • 3. Night Creeper by Zdzisław Beksiński - Historical Artwork


    • Zdzisław Beksiński is known as the first person to create Surrealist Dystopian Art back in the early 1970s, a lot his work inspired the initial concept of my project as I wanted to go with a dystopian themed game. The Artwork that I referenced above (#3) really encapsulates the isolation and namelessness that I want players to experience as in my game the player is just yet another citicizen whos under the control of the government and is just another number to them. Now this goes into play with my second reference being the article on how we unwillingly train Google's AI models through their captcha systems, so these kinds of captcha systems is kind of what the game is going to replicate as a way to critique AI art and on a larger scale, systems we use daily collecting data from us for their own gain. To tie the entire game together, the game Assessment Examination free to play on itch.io stylistically is what the captchas are going to resemble format wise and this game is also what gave me the idea to create a 3D environment with the VCR tv and such, more so for aesthetic reasons. I think the VCR idea will give the game a more unsettling experience, at least that's what I am hoping for.
